BR_text.BRsummary: nlp.vocab.vectors.resize gives 'numpy.uint64' object is not iterable
BR_text.BRdescription:
Steps to reproduce:
 <denchmark-code>>>> import spacy
 >>> nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_md")
 >>> nlp.vocab.vectors.resize((100,80))
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
   File "vectors.pyx", line 153, in spacy.vectors.Vectors.resize
 TypeError: 'numpy.uint64' object is not iterable
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
 
 
 spaCy version: 2.0.1
 Platform: Linux-4.10.0-38-generic-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-17.04-zesty
 Python version: 3.5.3
 Models: en, en_core_web_md

comments_1.comment_text: Thanks! And even a release so I can use it already! Amazing.

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/honnibal>@honnibal</denchmark-link>
  Spoke too soon :(
 Running the same example in 2.0.2 now gives
 <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
   File "vectors.pyx", line 153, in spacy.vectors.Vectors.resize
 RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration
 </denchmark-code>
